function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on STRAVA data as a representation of recreational activity may not capture the full spectrum of users, potentially skewing the results.","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of recreational activity levels, leading to flawed analysis and decision-making.","Mitigation":"Use multiple data sources and validation methods to cross-check STRAVA data, and consider the limitations of STRAVA user data in interpretations.","Technologies":"Data validation and integration tools, statistical models for data correction.","People":"Researchers, data analysts, urban planners, public health experts.","Owner":"Research institutions, local government, data analysis teams."},{"Description":"Conversion of relative estimates into absolute activity numbers may introduce errors due to calibration and sampling limitations.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of recreational activity levels, leading to inaccurate city-wide counts and trends.","Mitigation":"Incorporate error margins and confidence intervals into the analysis, validate absolute counts with other data sources, and consider the limitations of calibration methods.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, error estimation techniques, calibration validation tools.","People":"Data analysts, statisticians, calibration experts, urban planners.","Owner":"Research teams, data analysis units, local government."},{"Description":"Detrending the time series data to account for the long-term trend in STRAVA data may oversimplify the analysis and mask important variations in activity patterns.","Impact":"Loss of nuance in understanding recreational activity trends, leading to misrepresentation of true activity dynamics.","Mitigation":"Use detrending methods cautiously, consider the impact of detrending on data interpretation, and explore alternative approaches to capture long-term trends without losing short-term variations.","Technologies":"Time series analysis tools, advanced statistical modeling, trend visualization techniques.","People":"Data analysts, statisticians, trend analysis experts, urban planners.","Owner":"Research teams, data analysis units."}]}
